text: Albert Curtis Clark, (21 February 1859 – 5 February 1937) was an English classical scholar, who specialised in Latin literature, Cicero, and the New Testament. From 1913 to 1934, he was Corpus Christi Professor of Latin at the University of Oxford. He was also President of the Classical Association from 1930 to 1931. ==Works== * * * ==References== ==External links== * Category:1859 births Category:1937 deaths Category:English classical scholars Category:British classical philologists Category:Latinists Category:New Testament scholars Category:Corpus Christi Professors of Latin
title: Albert Curtis Clark
